data.title: Full of authentic flavors of Korea in Eugene
data.text: Each time my partner and I dine here we are delighted to taste a delicious the array of Korean food here in Eugene.  From Kimchi to California rolls from spicy chicken to teriyaki....excellent and authentic.  It is like being invited to dine in a family dining room.  A must try.

data.title: Worth Finding in Eugene
data.text:
Hidden inside a nondescript building on a busy Eugene Street is Café Ari Rang.  One enters to be promptly greeted by a friendly Korean accent and invitation to be seated.  A menu presents Korean and Japanese dishes from appetizers to soup and stew, tempura, bowls and boxes – all presented with a side of kimchi at no extra charge.  

Meals are served quickly and hot.  Though a little heavy with deep fried ingredients, flavors meld well for a different and pleasant surprise.  The spice tofu bowl arrives with a mildly spicy Korean style hot sauce that is more sweet and tangy than hot.  Mixed with a few splashes of Sriracha and the sauce generates just enough heat to complement the key flavors of the Korean sauce.

Reasonably priced, genuine Korean home cooked atmosphere and food.  Highly recommended.

data.title: Disappointment
data.text:
There is a reason this restaurant always looks empty. I like Korean food, a lot but this food was cold, the portions were small and the staff were not welcoming. The landscaping, if you can call it that is weeds.
Cold food, poor portions. In gracious service, overpriced
